SEARCH
Package database

Class DataBase

Object
DataBase
public class DataBase extends Object
Represents a database manager that handles the interaction with various DAO (Data Access Object) components, such as user, medicine, schedule, and appointment data.
Since:
2024-10-26
Version:
9.12
Author:
Chin Linn Sheng

  • Field Summary

    The Data Access Object (DAO) responsible for managing medicine data.
    private static ScheduleDAO
    scheduleDAO
    The Data Access Object (DAO) responsible for managing schedule data, which depends on the userDAO for user-specific data.
    private static UserDAO
    userDAO
    The Data Access Object (DAO) responsible for managing user data.

      The Data Access Object (DAO) responsible for managing user data.

    • medicineDAO

      private static MedicineDAO medicineDAO
      The Data Access Object (DAO) responsible for managing medicine data.

    • scheduleDAO

      private static ScheduleDAO scheduleDAO
      The Data Access Object (DAO) responsible for managing schedule data, which depends on the userDAO for user-specific data.

    • appointmentDAO

      private static AppointmentDAO appointmentDAO
      The Data Access Object (DAO) responsible for managing appointment data.

  • Constructor Details

    • DataBase

      public DataBase()
      Constructs the DataBase object and initializes the necessary DAOs. Also initializes the data if it's the first time the system is being booted.

  • Method Details

    • initializeData

      private static void initializeData()
      Initializes the data by reading the data files and loading the necessary information. If it's the first time the application is running, it will set up initial data.

    • writeData

      public static void writeData()
      Writes the current data of users, medicines, schedules, and appointments back to their respective data files.

    • getNumberOfPatients

      public static int getNumberOfPatients()
      Gets the total number of patients stored in the user database.
      Returns:
      the number of patients

    • getNumberOfDoctors

      public static int getNumberOfDoctors()
      Gets the total number of doctors stored in the user database.
      Returns:
      the number of doctors

    • getNumberOfAdminstrators

      public static int getNumberOfAdminstrators()
      Gets the total number of administrators stored in the user database.
      Returns:
      the number of administrators

    • getNumberOfPharmacists

      public static int getNumberOfPharmacists()
      Gets the total number of pharmacists stored in the user database.
      Returns:
      the number of pharmacists

    • getCurrentUserID

      public static String getCurrentUserID()
      Gets the ID of the currently logged-in user.
      Returns:
      the current user ID

    • setCurrentUserID

      public static void setCurrentUserID(String currentUserID)
      Sets the ID of the current user.
      Parameters:
      currentUserID - the ID of the user to set as the current user

    • getUsers

      public static HashMap<String,User> getUsers()
      Retrieves all users stored in the user database.
      Returns:
      a HashMap containing user IDs as keys and User objects as values

    • getMedicines

      public static HashMap<String,Medicine> getMedicines()
      Retrieves all medicines stored in the medicine database.
      Returns:
      a HashMap containing medicine IDs as keys and Medicine objects as values

    • increaseUserCount

      public static void increaseUserCount(Role role)
      Increases the count of users of a specific role in the user database.
      Parameters:
      role - the role whose user count should be increased

    • decreaseUserCount

      public static void decreaseUserCount(Role role)
      Decreases the count of users of a specific role in the user database.
      Parameters:
      role - the role whose user count should be decreased
